stacks.name: MERN Stack
stacks.description: The MERN stack is a popular choice for building dynamic web applications. It utilizes JavaScript across the stack, making it simpler for someone with existing JavaScript knowledge to adopt. React.js offers a powerful and flexible frontend, ideal for a drag-and-drop interface. MongoDB's flexible schema makes it more adaptable for storing diverse design templates.

stacks.name: LAMP Stack
stacks.description: The LAMP stack is a tried-and-true collection of technologies for web development. While it may not be the most cutting-edge, its stability and maturity can be beneficial. MySQL provides a robust database solution, and PHP is widely known and easy to deploy. This stack will be a safe choice for a beginner transitioning from design to full-stack development.

stacks.name: Serverless w/ React
stacks.description: Serverless architecture offers scalability and faster development since infrastructure management is abstracted away. Firebase provides a fully managed, scalable NoSQL database that's easy to integrate with a web application. React.js as the frontend, complemented with Material-UI and TypeScript, will offer a modern, smooth, and type-safe development experience. This stack is beneficial for rapidly growing applications where scalability is crucial.
